definition: young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)

sentences.english: In those ancient stores, the needlework is the required course for girls.
sentences.chinese: 在古老故事里，女红是女子的必修课程。

sentences.english: The embroidery pays attention to elaboration hard, but the cooking calculate greatly of talent more vivid.
sentences.chinese: 女红讲究细心认真，厨艺却更看重天分灵活。

sentences.english: New needlework age is seen as an atmosphere created by modern needlework lovers in the new times.
sentences.chinese: 是指在新时代下的现代女红们所营造的一种氛围。

sentences.english: The highly praised slow life style revives gradually the needlework.
sentences.chinese: 伴随“慢生活”方式的备受推崇，女红逐渐复兴。

definition: needlework/working for a living as a needleworker
the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person
flying needle and running seam (idiom); skillful needlework
to be skillful with one's hands/to be manually adroit
erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
a woman's virtue is to have no talent (idiom)
pinyin: nu:3 zi3 wu2 cai2 bian4 shi4 de2
